nodes.bodyText: First argument should go on the next line

This is not something the code formatter changes. There are many instances of this to fix across the code base and would need to be done separately (not sure how to automate it). But I can fix these by hand as part of this PR if you want.

I agree, but there doesn't seem be a good way to make this work with the formatter. We could make it something like
//noinspection PointlessBooleanExpression
if (type.getJavaType().equals(Slice.class) && (false ||
But that seems worse. Do you have a suggestion, or is this simply a comment that you wished the code formatter worked better here?

You could also consider changing the formatter setting Wrapping and Braces > Binary Expressions > Align when multiline

We'd need to see if Checkstyle would work with that type of formatting rule.
I don't have a suggestion, but I was hoping there might be a way to tweak the formatter to do something better. Oh well. Let's leave it as you have it now.

Same as above. Another option is to do
if ((typeHasNaN(leftType) || typeHasNaN(rightType))
        && (operator == GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL ||
        operator == GREATER_THAN ||
        operator == LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL ||
        operator == LESS_THAN)) {
Or this could use
if ((typeHasNaN(leftType) || typeHasNaN(rightType)) && EnumSet.of(
        GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL,
        GREATER_THAN,
        LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL,
        LESS_THAN)
        .contains(operator)) {
But those don't look like an improvement.
